intro: Haplanthus laxiflorus var. recedens, commonly known as the slender-flowered haplanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color. This variant is noted for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
